column2: In the old times, whenever Braavos stood in danger, the titan would step with fire in his eyes

column1: BRIENNE Bunch? What's a bunch? 100? 6? 20? PODRICK

column2: Lord Baelish, Lady Sansa, my name is Brienne of Tarth

column1: Baelish gestures to the knights to welcome her; Brienne goes through and takes a knee in front of Sansa BRIENNE
column2: Lady Sansa, before your mother's death, I was her sworn sword

column1: (Brienne gets up) You are Catelyn Stark's sworn sword? BRIENNE

column2: By men who didn't see what happened

Neither of us wanted to be there

column1: Why don't you stay? Brienne walks away KNIGHT 1

column2: I guess that means you’re unarmed
Down, Podrick, down! Podrick gets down
Wary of strangers, as she should me
My lady, if those Stark girls refused your service, maybe you’re released from your vow
I swore to their mother I’d protect those girls
Of course it’s a threat! Our daughter’s in Dorne surrounded by people who hate our family
They blame us for the death of Oberyn and his sister, and every other tragedy that’s befallen their cursed country

column1: I will burn their cities to the ground if they touch her! JAIME

column2: Then don’t call her your daughter
If I was the father to any of my children, they’d be stoned in the streets
And what has your caution brought? Our eldest child murdered at his own wedding
You can’t just ask Prince Doran to give her back! She’s promised his son
I’m not going to ask him anything
You go there with an army, it’s an act of war

column1: Do you know where they’re keeping her? CERSEI

column2: It's a fine place, isn't it? A fine place
You know what I think? I think you're a good person
I've been all over the world
Who's that? Jaime is sitting on a stone wall, waiting for Bronn
I was very sorry to hear about your father

column1: When were you planning on getting married? BRONN

column2: Lollys will be marrying Ser Wyllis Bracken
We made a deal, your sister and I
I would have advised against that
The prince does not wish to be disturbed
Your brother was murdered, and you sit here at the Water Gardens, staring at the sky and doing nothing
Oberyn was slain during a trial by combat
What will you do about his death
Then we are lucky the whole country does not decide
The Sand Snakes are with me
And how long will that be? Ellaria exits the room
Anyone can see you coming from a mile off
My Second Sons, on the other hand, they drink, they whore, fight in the streets--they blend in
Sons of the Harpy, they want to put a collar back on my neck
I think you should exercise restraint, Your Grace
The Son of the Harpy has no more valuable information
And the information you did get, he is young and poor
I don't know it, and I'm the head of a great family
We do not know what this man did or didn't do
I do not know the place from where Old Ser comes
Thank you all for your counsel
Your Grace, a word, please, I beg you
The Mad King? You're here to remind me of my enemies' lies? Consider me reminded
Your Grace, I served in his Kingsguard
When the people rose in revolt against him, your father set their towns and castles aflame
I will not have the Son of the Harpy executed without a fair trial
She ought to offer her cunt
You were quite good, you know
Managed to kill a lot of people
Yes, but showed great promise in other areas as well
She wanted me to leave King's Landing
And we find them repulsive, which is why we surround ourselves with large, comfortable boxes to keep them away
How many dwarves are there in the world? Is Cersei going to kill them all? INT
He called your experience and wisdom in financial matters unparalleled
The honor is all mine, Your Grace
Your Grace, in the past on several occasions, a Grand Maester has served as the King's Hand
The King has named Qyburn the new Master of Whisperers
That is kind of you to say
The king is very busy at this moment
He should be here, learning what it means to rule

column1: (looks to Qyburn) Sending your own brother away so he wouldn't be-- CERSEI
column2: My brother has left the capital to lead a sensitive diplomatic mission
I do not recognize your authority to dictate what is and is not my concern
Right, very good! Sam is reading in a different aisle in the library

column1: What do you call it north of the Wall? GILLY

column2: My father made them move out of the keep into the huts outside

I ordered Mance Rayder burnt at the stake

Lady of Bear Island, and a child of 10

column1: What's your life going to be like on the Wall with Thorne in command? JON

column2: Your bravery made him look weak

Ser Alliser fought bravely, it is true

Jon Snow! Jon Snow! Jon Snow! Jon Snow! Jon rises, sees Alliser glaring at him, and lets out a small smile for the first time since he entered the room

column2: You said there was no Jaqen H'ghar here
